azure.storage.blob.upload_blob_to_url(*blob_url: [str](https://docs.python.org/3.11/library/stdtypes.html#str "(in Python v3.11)")*, *data: [Iterable](https://docs.python.org/3.11/library/typing.html#typing.Iterable "(in Python v3.11)") \| [IO](https://docs.python.org/3.11/library/typing.html#typing.IO "(in Python v3.11)")*, *credential: [str](https://docs.python.org/3.11/library/stdtypes.html#str "(in Python v3.11)") \| [Dict](https://docs.python.org/3.11/library/typing.html#typing.Dict "(in Python v3.11)")\[[str](https://docs.python.org/3.11/library/stdtypes.html#str "(in Python v3.11)"), [str](https://docs.python.org/3.11/library/stdtypes.html#str "(in Python v3.11)")\] \| AzureNamedKeyCredential \| AzureSasCredential \| TokenCredential \| [None](https://docs.python.org/3.11/library/constants.html#None "(in Python v3.11)") = None*, *\*\*kwargs: [Any](https://docs.python.org/3.11/library/typing.html#typing.Any "(in Python v3.11)")*) → [Dict](https://docs.python.org/3.11/library/typing.html#typing.Dict "(in Python v3.11)")\[[str](https://docs.python.org/3.11/library/stdtypes.html#str "(in Python v3.11)"), [Any](https://docs.python.org/3.11/library/typing.html#typing.Any "(in Python v3.11)")\][\[source\]](https://azuresdkdocs.blob.core.windows.net/$web/python/azure-storage-blob/12.22.0/_modules/azure/storage/blob.html#upload_blob_to_url)[¶](https://azuresdkdocs.blob.core.windows.net/$web/python/azure-storage-blob/12.22.0/azure.storage.blob.html#azure.storage.blob.upload_blob_to_url "Link to this definition")

:   Upload data to a given URL

    The data will be uploaded as a block blob.

    Parameters:

    :   -   **blob_url** ([*str*](https://docs.python.org/3.11/library/stdtypes.html#str "(in Python v3.11)")) -- The full URI to the blob. This can also include a SAS token.

        -   **data** ([*bytes*](https://docs.python.org/3.11/library/stdtypes.html#bytes "(in Python v3.11)") *or* [*str*](https://docs.python.org/3.11/library/stdtypes.html#str "(in Python v3.11)") *or* *Iterable*) -- The data to upload. This can be bytes, text, an iterable or a file-like object.

        -   **credential** ([*AzureNamedKeyCredential*](https://azuresdkdocs.blob.core.windows.net/$web/python/azure-core/latest/azure.core.html#azure.core.credentials.AzureNamedKeyCredential "(in Azure SDK for Python v2.0.0)") *or* [*AzureSasCredential*](https://azuresdkdocs.blob.core.windows.net/$web/python/azure-core/latest/azure.core.html#azure.core.credentials.AzureSasCredential "(in Azure SDK for Python v2.0.0)") *or* [*TokenCredential*](https://azuresdkdocs.blob.core.windows.net/$web/python/azure-core/latest/azure.core.html#azure.core.credentials.TokenCredential "(in Azure SDK for Python v2.0.0)") *or* [*str*](https://docs.python.org/3.11/library/stdtypes.html#str "(in Python v3.11)") *or* [*dict*](https://docs.python.org/3.11/library/stdtypes.html#dict "(in Python v3.11)")*\[*[*str*](https://docs.python.org/3.11/library/stdtypes.html#str "(in Python v3.11)")*,* [*str*](https://docs.python.org/3.11/library/stdtypes.html#str "(in Python v3.11)")*\] or* *None*) -- The credentials with which to authenticate. This is optional if the blob URL already has a SAS token. The value can be a SAS token string, an instance of a AzureSasCredential or AzureNamedKeyCredential from azure.core.credentials, an account shared access key, or an instance of a TokenCredentials class from azure.identity. If the resource URI already contains a SAS token, this will be ignored in favor of an explicit credential - except in the case of AzureSasCredential, where the conflicting SAS tokens will raise a ValueError. If using an instance of AzureNamedKeyCredential, "name" should be the storage account name, and "key" should be the storage account key.

    Keyword Arguments:

    :   -   **overwrite** ([*bool*](https://docs.python.org/3.11/library/functions.html#bool "(in Python v3.11)")) -- Whether the blob to be uploaded should overwrite the current data. If True, upload_blob_to_url will overwrite any existing data. If set to False, the operation will fail with a ResourceExistsError.

        -   **max_concurrency** ([*int*](https://docs.python.org/3.11/library/functions.html#int "(in Python v3.11)")) -- The number of parallel connections with which to download.

        -   **length** ([*int*](https://docs.python.org/3.11/library/functions.html#int "(in Python v3.11)")) -- Number of bytes to read from the stream. This is optional, but should be supplied for optimal performance.

        -   **metadata** ([*dict*](https://docs.python.org/3.11/library/stdtypes.html#dict "(in Python v3.11)")*(*[*str*](https://docs.python.org/3.11/library/stdtypes.html#str "(in Python v3.11)")*,*[*str*](https://docs.python.org/3.11/library/stdtypes.html#str "(in Python v3.11)")*)*) -- Name-value pairs associated with the blob as metadata.

        -   **validate_content** ([*bool*](https://docs.python.org/3.11/library/functions.html#bool "(in Python v3.11)")) -- If true, calculates an MD5 hash for each chunk of the blob. The storage service checks the hash of the content that has arrived with the hash that was sent. This is primarily valuable for detecting bitflips on the wire if using http instead of https as https (the default) will already validate. Note that this MD5 hash is not stored with the blob. Also note that if enabled, the memory-efficient upload algorithm will not be used, because computing the MD5 hash requires buffering entire blocks, and doing so defeats the purpose of the memory-efficient algorithm.

        -   **encoding** ([*str*](https://docs.python.org/3.11/library/stdtypes.html#str "(in Python v3.11)")) -- Encoding to use if text is supplied as input. Defaults to UTF-8.

    Returns:

    :   Blob-updated property dict (Etag and last modified)

    Return type:

    :   [dict](https://docs.python.org/3.11/library/stdtypes.html#dict "(in Python v3.11)")([str](https://docs.python.org/3.11/library/stdtypes.html#str "(in Python v3.11)"), Any)
